resources.string: Swipe Up and Hold from Left
Swipe Up and Hold from Center
Swipe Up and Hold from Right
Keep Pill Shown in other Overlay Apps
Don\'t Hide NavBar on Lock Screen
Customize appearance of the navigation pill
Wondering how to use the app? We\'re here to help.
If you have some feedback, we\'d love to hear it!
Have a question about the app? Visit the XDA thread and ask away.
XDA has other apps too. Check them out!
Unlock more functionality with the premium add-on.
adb shell pm grant com.xda.nobar android.permission.WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS
This notification prevents Android from stopping the app. Hide it by long-pressing and going to Settings.
Prevent the pill from moving above the keyboard.
Certain devices show the original navigation bar on the side in landscape. Activate this to prevent that behavior.
Some devices are able to rotate the screen when the device is upside down, which can cause the original navigation bar to show. Enable this option to make sure it stays hidden.
Many tablets force the navigation bar to always be on the bottom of the screen. Turn this on to account for that behavior.
When activated, the pill will automatically hide in fullscreen apps (e.g. videos or games).
DO NOT CHANGE THESE OPTIONS UNLESS YOU NEED THEM! THEY CAN CAUSE PROBLEMS INSTEAD OF FIXING THEM!
Enable this to make the pill easier to swipe.
Only use this if your device has a software navigation bar.
When enabled, the original navigation bar will be accessible with a swipe in fullscreen apps.
Set dimension using pixel count rather than percentages.
Divide the pill into three sections, each with their own set of actions.
When enabled, Navigation Gestures will not disable in Car Mode. Don\'t enable this on TouchWiz devices if you have a software navigation bar.
Tap OK to allow Navigation Gestures to write to system settings.
Split Pill enabled! Do you want to try our recommended settings for this mode?
Enable Android\'s Immersive Navigation Mode when Hide Navigation Bar is active. This fixes issues on Samsung devices such as the \"Hard press Home button\" not working.
Choose which apps should always show the original navigation bar.
Choose which apps should never show the pill.
Choose which apps should not use immersive mode.
When enabled, the pill will automatically hide after the specified delay.
Split Pill disabled! Do you want us to set affected settings back to default?
Choose which apps the pill should be forced to stay on top. Useful for apps like Facebook Messenger chat heads, Drupe, etc.
THESE FEATURES ARE INCOMPLETE AND MAY NOT WORK ON YOUR DEVICE!
By default, Navigation Gestures leaves 1 pixel of the original navbar visible. Enable this to remove that pixel. WARNING: This will break certain devices!!!
Toggle whether or not the gesture pill is displayed onscreen.
Toggle whether or not the device\'s software navigation bar should be hidden.
Enable this to show lock screen shortcuts and to fix issues with items being cut off on the lock screen, ambient display, or always on display.
This app brings awesome navigation gestures to any Android device. Best of all, it doesn\’t need root! Before you can use the gestures, there are a few things we have to do to set the app up.

In order for Navigation Gestures to show the pill-nav, you will need to grant permission for it to draw over other apps. Tap the button below to do so. If you installed from the Play Store, this permission will already be granted.
This app uses an Accessibility Service to simulate the original navigation buttons. Click \“Grant\” below to enable access.

We can completely hide your stock navigation bar, but we need access to a special permission to do so. Click the button below to learn how you can grant it. If you are rooted, accept the root prompt. If you don\'t have a software navigation bar, or your phone has another way to hide the software navigation bar, you can skip this step.\n\nNOTE: ADB is not root! It will not void your warranty, trip KNOX, etc.
You\'re ready to use Navigation Gestures! You can toggle the pill on the following page or from the Quick Settings tile (Nougat and later).
You\’re ready to use navigation gestures on your device.

Don\'t worry. You can still use this app. Root actually makes the setup easier. If you like, we can use root access to grant this permission automatically. Otherwise, you can choose to use the tutorial/manual method.
Looks like one or more permissions got revoked somehow. No worries, though. We\'ll help get you back up and running.
This action requires the premium add-on. Would you like to purchase it?
This action requires a device running Android Nougat or later. Sorry about that.

Android Nougat allows for custom quick settings tiles, and we\'ve included one to toggle Navigation Gestures. You can add it by swiping down twice from the status bar, tapping the pencil icon or \"EDIT\" and dragging Navigation Gestures\' tile into the active area.

This app uses an Accessibility Service to simulate navigation button presses like the back, home, and multitasking buttons. We do not use it to collect any personal information, and no action will be performed except by the user.
Because your device is running Android P, this app will not currently work.
Before you uninstall Navigation Gestures, make sure you unhide the software navigation bar using the toggle in the app! You only need to do this if you hide the navigation bar using our app.
Using this app you may notice a small white bar at the very bottom of the display. This is not a bug! It is required to prevent much more serious issues. It should not occur on TouchWiz devices.
While using this app, if you notice that the original navigation bar is present when it shouldn\'t be, head over to Settings>>Compatibility and try the compatibility options there.
You can always come back to this step by toggling the Hide Navigation Bar switch on in the main screen of this app.
This feature cannot be used while Navigation Gestures is hiding the navigation bar.
Hmm. It seems this permission wasn\'t granted. Make sure to follow all instructions, and try again.
Pill hidden. Tap or swipe up to reshow.
Make sure \"Hide Navigation Bar\" is off before uninstalling!
Navigation Gestures is currently keeping your screen awake.
\u2022 Pill moves to the bottom of the screen
\u2022 Swipe up from left/right for back
\u2022 Swipe up from middle for home
\u2022 Swipe up from middle and hold for multitasking
